title: Volleyball & Badminton
description: How well do you know volleyball and badminton, two exciting net sports?

questions.question: How many players are on each team in indoor volleyball?
questions.explanation: Indoor volleyball teams have 6 players on the court at a time. Players rotate positions after winning a rally from the receiving team, ensuring all players play each position.

questions.question: In which country was volleyball invented?
questions.explanation: Volleyball was invented in 1895 by William G. Morgan in Holyoke, Massachusetts, USA. Morgan created it as a less physically demanding alternative to basketball.

questions.question: What is the shuttlecock (birdie) in badminton made of?
questions.explanation: A traditional badminton shuttlecock consists of a cork base with 16 goose feathers inserted into it. Synthetic (plastic) shuttlecocks are also commonly used in recreational play.

questions.question: How many players are on each side in beach volleyball?
questions.explanation: Beach volleyball is played with 2 players per team on a sand court. It became an Olympic sport in 1996 at the Atlanta Games.

questions.question: Which country has traditionally dominated badminton at the Olympic Games?
questions.explanation: China has been the dominant force in Olympic badminton, winning the most gold medals. Indonesia, South Korea, and Japan are also strong badminton nations.

questions.question: How many sets does a team need to win in indoor volleyball?
questions.explanation: Indoor volleyball matches are played as best of 5 sets. The first four sets are played to 25 points, while a deciding fifth set is played to 15 points, with a 2-point lead required.

questions.question: What is a 'spike' in volleyball?
options: A powerful overhead hit aimed at the opponent's court
A serve from the back line
questions.explanation: A spike (or attack hit) is a powerful overhead hit where a player jumps and strikes the ball forcefully downward into the opponent's court. It is the primary offensive weapon in volleyball.

questions.question: What is the fastest recorded speed of a badminton smash?
questions.explanation: The fastest badminton smash has been recorded at over 400 km/h (approximately 250 mph), making badminton the fastest racket sport in terms of initial shuttle speed.

questions.question: What is the 'libero' position in volleyball?
options: A defensive specialist who wears a different colored jersey
The tallest player on the team
questions.explanation: The libero is a defensive specialist who wears a different colored jersey. They can freely substitute for any back-row player and are not allowed to serve, spike, or play at the net.

questions.question: When did badminton become an Olympic sport?
questions.explanation: Badminton became a full medal sport at the 1992 Barcelona Olympics. It had been a demonstration sport at the 1972 Munich Games.

questions.question: Which country's men's volleyball team is known for a distinctive jumping serve style and has won multiple Olympic golds?
questions.explanation: Brazil is one of the most successful men's volleyball nations, winning Olympic gold medals and multiple World Championships. They are known for their athleticism and powerful playing style.

questions.question: How many points do you need to win a game in badminton?
questions.explanation: In modern badminton, games are played to 21 points with rally scoring (a point scored on every rally). A player must win by 2 points, with a ceiling of 30 points.

questions.question: What is a 'dig' in volleyball?
options: A hand signal from the coach
A defensive pass made to save a hard-driven ball
questions.explanation: A dig is a defensive skill used to prevent the ball from touching the court after a spike or attack. It typically involves a forearm pass from a low position.

questions.question: In which Asian country is badminton considered the national sport?
questions.explanation: Badminton is considered the national sport of Indonesia, where it is immensely popular. Indonesian players have won numerous Olympic medals and World Championship titles in the sport.

questions.question: How many touches is each team allowed before returning the ball in volleyball?
questions.explanation: Each team is allowed a maximum of 3 touches (contacts) to return the ball over the net, not counting a block touch. The typical sequence is a pass, set, and spike.
